channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rainwater collects at the edge of the road, 3rd October
item.description:
The entire flat section of new road, either side of the bus stop rainwater collects and passing vehicles spray the pavement. There is no problem with the stormwater drain, road gradient and subsistence mean that rainwater collects and does not flow into the drain.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous dumping of domestic rubbish, 3rd October
item.description:
Hi, this happens all the time. Earlier, I sent a report, you kindly dealt with it and emailed to say the issue was resolved. A few hours later, more bags have been dumped! So the root cause isn't resolved, rubbish will continue to be left here. thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped washing machine, 3rd October
item.description:
Washing machine dumped thatâ€™s been pushed over blocking the pavement, have to walk in road to get past
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead tree at the bottom of, 46 Ingleton Ave, Welling DA16 2JU, 3rd October
item.description:
There is a large tree at the end of 46 Ingleton Ave, Welling DA16 2JU. This tree has been taken over by ivy, and has died. Pieces of this tree has been falling off for a while. Due to the recent high winds and further predictions of ogj winds. I am concerned that this tree could fall over. The tree is on the boarder of an alleyway that is a public footpath. Due to this the tree could endanger the public, and also if it falls damage property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowper Close, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closure signs and cones blown over, 3rd October
item.description:
The road is closed. The signs and cones that were blocking the road have blown over. Cars are trying to access the road still as they cannot see the road closure sign when turning left. This is causing traffic jams and a great deal of car horn usage at all hours.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Marshall Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs replacing as now leaning towards building and is dangerous, 3rd October
item.description:
The Crab Apple Tree is now leaning towards both 14 and 14A Percy Road SE207QJ and could with the current wind fall over and damage both properties and the occupants . It has also started to lift the pavement and if it moves any further towards the building it will also bring the Telegraph pole down across the road as it has a landline, line going through it attached to that pole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Percy Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faeces in communal staircase, 3rd October
item.description:
There is what looks like human faeces on the staircase of the building, 3 staircases up. It smells and is attracting flies. There is also a pair of shoes on the second staircase up however this is a less pressing issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmington Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
